definition: (of a play, movie etc) to begin

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Ryan snuck into the movie after it started.
sentences.chinese: 雷恩在電影開演後偷溜進場。

sentences.english: By the time we got there, the movie had already begun.
sentences.chinese: 我們到那裏的時候，戲已經開演了。

sentences.english: I do lots of jumping rope for about a month and a half before the show.
sentences.chinese: 在維密秀開演之前我會花一個半月的時間大量地跳繩。

sentences.english: RL: When do you open the Mandalay Bay show?
sentences.chinese: 曼德勒海灣演出什麼時候開演？

sentences.english: The movie starts in 5 minutes and there's bound to be a long line.
sentences.chinese: 電影將在5分鐘後開演，人們一定正排着長隊。

sentences.english: The play begins at 7 p.m. this evening.
On the theater page there was a review from New York of a new play that had just opened.
sentences.chinese: 在戲劇欄裏，有一篇劇評提到紐約來的剛開演的新戲。

sentences.english: The three-hour concert started as scheduled.
sentences.chinese: 三小時的演唱會準時開演。

sentences.english: Clowns always make up before a circus show.
sentences.chinese: 馬戲開演前，小丑們都要化好妝。

sentences.english: The staff brought professional equipment to Redtory before the show began.
sentences.chinese: 開演之前，工作人員帶着專業器材來到紅專廠。

sentences.english: By the time we got there , the movie had already begun.
sentences.chinese: 我們到那裏的時候，電影已經開演了。

sentences.english: Le Cirque des Rêves, the circus of dreams, arrives without warning and opens at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 即夢幻的馬戲團毫無徵兆的到來並在黃昏開演。

definition: to begin/to open/to start/beginning of an event
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
the number of showings of a movie, play etc/screening/performance
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
to open ballot boxes/to count votes/to make out a voucher or invoice etc/to write out a receipt
